request_pathways.name: Written request to Privacy Officer P.O. Box

forms.document_type: ROI authorization form (WRONG ORGANIZATION — La Clinica del Valle, Oregon)
ROI authorization form (WRONG ORGANIZATION — La Clinica Health Centers, Oregon)

access_pathway.primary_pathway_description: Patients must write a letter to the Privacy Officer at a P.O. Box; no form, portal, or electronic submission option is provided for record requests.

red_flags: No ROI form published online — patients of this FQHC must write a letter with no form to guide them
Only documented submission method is postal mail to a P.O. Box
Notice of Privacy Practices is from 2012 and has not been updated in over 13 years
bright_spots: NPP available in English, Spanish, and Chinese — reflecting community language needs
NPP explicitly acknowledges right to receive PHI in electronic format

findability.rationale: Level 1: Effectively unfindable online — no ROI form exists on the website, and the only records-request guidance is buried in an 8-page NPP with no dedicated 'Medical Records' page.

technical_accessibility.rationale: Level 1: No usable digital form exists — the only documented process is composing a letter and mailing it to a P.O. Box, with no fillable form, no fax option, and no electronic submission.

content_design.rationale: Level 1: Unusable without significant effort — no records-request form exists, so a patient must read an 8-page NPP to discover they should write a letter, with no guidance on what to include.

patient_centeredness.rationale: Level 2: Patient self-access is an afterthought — the NPP acknowledges the right of access but provides no practical mechanism; there is no form, no online pathway, and no differentiation from third-party release.

compliance.rationale: Level 3: The NPP does not impose illegal barriers (no notarization, no excessive fees), but vague fee language, a 13-year-old document, and a mail-only process with no structured form go beyond what patients should have to navigate for access.

overall.summary: La Clínica de La Raza publishes no records-request form online; the only documented pathway is writing a letter to a P.O. Box, creating a significant barrier for patients of this FQHC.
